Preventive measures:
 1.Planting resistant varieties 2.Adaptation of planting and harvesting time 3.Crop rotation 4.Various hygiene measures (healthy and quality planting material, infestation of equipment)

Defense measures: 
	Biological; various beneficial viruses, fungi, bacteria, and insects as predators (ladybug) 
	Cultural; tracking of weather, monitoring of fields and crops 
	Physical; collecting insects and their destruction, disinfection of the soil, seed, and seedlings 
	Chemical, use of insecticides 

The final measure of a farmerâ€™s crop protection practice depends on the type of crop production. Conventional farmers use various pesticides as a most common protection measure.
